bill_title: allow free tuition to certain members of the military.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow free tuition to certain members of the military. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-55 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any resident of this state who was awarded a Purple Heart Medal from any branch of the armed forces of the United States after August 2, 1990, shall be entitled to tuition without cost and be entitled to attend any course or courses of study in any state educational institution under the control and management of the Board of Regents or state supported postsecondary technical institute. Section 2. That § 13-55-9.4 be amended to read as follows: 13-55-9.4. Any person desiring to avail himself or herself of the benefits of section 1 of this Act or § 13-55-9.2 shall make application to the Board of Regents or the South Dakota Board of Education therefor, and it shall be the duty of the respective boards to shall determine whether such person so applying is entitled to the benefits of section 1 of this Act or § 13-55- 9.2, at institutions under their respective jurisdiction or control, and to that end the boards are authorized and empowered to promulgate rules and regulations not inconsistent therewith in order to accomplish the purposes of section 1 of this Act and §§ 13-55-9.1 to 13-55-9.7, inclusive.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
